H0.text: What 2008 film is an adaptation by Andrew Davies of a book by Sarah Waters, that is set in a Victorian-era women's prison. Fingersmith

H1.text: What 2008 film is an adaptation by Andrew Davies of a book by Sarah Waters, that is set in a Victorian-era women's prison. The Little Stranger

H2.text: What 2008 film is an adaptation by Andrew Davies of a book by Sarah Waters, that is set in a Victorian-era women's prison. Tipping the Velvet

H3.text: What 2008 film is an adaptation by Andrew Davies of a book by Sarah Waters, that is set in a Victorian-era women's prison. Affinal

A4.text: The Little Stranger is a 2009 gothic novel set in a dilapidated mansion in Warwickshire, England in the 1940s.

A5.text: In autumn 2018, a film adaptation directed by Lenny Abrahamson and starring Domhnall Gleeson and Ruth Wilson was released.

A6.text: Tipping the Velvet was adapted into a three-part television series by the BBC in 2002.

A7.text: Tipping the Velvet is set in England during the 1890s, not in a Victorian-era women's prison.
